text: Marguerite Germaine Marie Donnadieu (, 4 April 1914 â€“ 3 March 1996), known as Marguerite Duras (), was a French writer and movie director. She first used the surname Duras on her 1943 novel Les Impudents. She wrote The Lover, which was later made into a 1992 movie. Duras was born in Saigon, Vietnam.
